Posts.Content: Well we went to the doctor wednesday. She will be going in for surgery next week to get a masectomy and reconstructive surgery. They say its Stage 1 right now but they will check her lymph nodes during surgery next week. She will for sure have to have chemotherapy . But we will make the best of it! She went back today to talk to the doctors about surgery. I'm really worried about it, but I know everything will be ok. She is ok with the surgery and everything, but she's scared of chemotherapy (like anyone would be) We are going to be looking for wig specialists to see if we can get her a wig b/c they told her for sure she would lose her hair. If anyone has any info on wig specialists somewhere in North Carolina. Please let me know. I appreciate all the messages and emails you guys have sent. It means so much. I look forward to getting more! Thanks so much, Danielle
Posts.Signature: My mom She is 44 Diagnosed 3/7/05 Lumpectomy Mastectomy 3/29/05 Lymph node biopsy 3/24/05 1 cm Invasive Ductal Carcinoma Stage IIA Chemo started 5/5/05 AC Taxol (dose dense) Neupogen shots every other day for 4 months ER+
Posts.Title: Update on my mom

Posts.Content: thanks for responding everybody. I did check out the websites you guys recommended and she found 2 she loves and look just like her hair. She will be ordering them soon. Seeing that she could find wigs like that, I think makes her feel better about chemo. She goes thursday for surgery. They will remove 2 lymphnodes to test them. The doc says its only a 20% chance it spread to the lymph nodes. So i'm hoping and praying he's right. She goes the following tuesday to have a mast. on her right breast and reconstructive surgery following it. Thanks again for all the help and support. If anyone has any more info on chemo or anything, please let me know. Thanks again everybody Danielle

But, last time we went, they said it would last 12-16 weeks and she will get treatment every 3 weeks. We're confused. Has anyone had this type of chemo. I know its pretty aggressive If anyone has any information on this or experiences, please let me know. She will be starting it in about 2 weeks. Thanks, Danielle

Posts.Title: Very painful breast

Posts.Content: Diane, I am so sorry you are having to go through all of this. There is help out there for breast cancer. I don't know your job or m oney situation, but there is soemthing called breast cancer medicaid for people with out insurance. It pays for EVERYTHING. Bill Clinton passed it a few years back. If you are under these circumstances, you should definitely check into this. My mom had a lumpectomy. She was back to work the next day, never sick or anything afterwards. So you should be fine. I think its a pretty simple and routine surgery. My mom is going to have a mastectomy tuesday b/c she still had some calcium deposits scattered around in her breast, they're not sure if they're cancer until they take them out and since they're scattered, if they took them out piece by piece, it would already take off half of her breast so for precaution, they are going to go ahead and to a mast. I hope everything goes ok with you. I will certainly be praying for you and you will be in my thoughts. Please let us know how everything goes when you recover from surgery. Do they know if its cancer yet? let us know! Danielle

Posts.Title: AC Taxol questions

Posts.Content: Hey everybody! Well my mom had her first chemo treatment this past thursday, May 5th. So far so good. They told her her hair would start clumping out by the 3rd day, but fortunately, none of that yet. She's doing great. She's doing all the things she was before she even started chemo. She feels a little weak at times, but thats it. We are very thankful so far. She is having dose dense AC Taxol. 4 weeks of AC and 4 weeks of Taxol. Is it normal to h ave dose dense although she has such an early stage?? She is also doing the Neupogen shots every other day to boost her white blood cell count. They are very expensive. $2,600 for only 2 of them (thats only a 4 day supply) (WHOA) Luckily my job has worked with me around my mom's sickness, so I am able to have off whenever I want just to be at home with her in case she needs anything. That makes things so much better. Someone please let me know if you have had the dose dense AC Taxol and let me know how everything went. Thanks so much Danielle

Posts.Title: Very painful breast

Posts.Content: Hey everybody. My mom had her mast. tuesday and we came home today. The doctors said everything went perfect, the mast. and the reconstruction. She's in a lot of pain though. It's bearable though. She had a lymph node biopsy last thursday, they removed 2 lymph nodes. They got back the path report and one of the lymph nodes they took out had a tumor on it, but fortunately it was less than a millimeter in size. They went on ahead while they were doing the mast. and reconstruction and took out all of the lymph nodes. We will find out about the results April 6th. the oncologist told us depending on how many lymph nodes were affected will determine the stage of cancer. We are hoping and praying for positive news. I will put an update after the 6th to let everyone know the news. Thanks for everything you guys!

Posts.Title: AC Taxol questions

Posts.Content: Hey Lindsey. My mom had Invasive Ductal Carcinoma. She is having AC + T like you are. She has done really good so far. So how did you find it? You are so young. It will make a world of difference if you stay strong throughout this whole thing. You will have your good days and bad, but just hang in there b/c this is very doable. You will find that all of these women on this breast cancer forum will support you through anything. If you're upset about something or just having a bad day, just get on here and tell everybody about it. If it weren't for these women on here, i wouldn't have been able to get through all of this. The women on here know exactly what you're going through b/c they've been on here before. If you ever want information since my mom has been through the same thing as you will see on the bio or you just want to talk, you can email me at [email protected]. I would love to keep in touch with you. I look forward to hearing from you. Danielle

Posts.Title: New here, Chemo Questions (p53 specific)

Posts.Content: Hey Karen. My name is Danielle. My mom has breast cancer. She was diagnosed in February with stage 2-one node IDC. So far she's doing really good. She finished the AC part. She did realy good with that just really fatigue. She has jsut started taxol. She's had a lot of bone pain, but nothing too terribly bad. How have you done with this. Do you have to have Taxol too? Sounds like you and my mom are going through the same treatment/diagnosis. I would like to keep in touch with you. My email address is [email protected]. I wish you the best and i hope to hear from you. Danielle

Posts.Title: First time post!

Posts.Content: Hey everybody. Well my mom was driving back and forth for chemo 2 hours away every 2 wks. But she found a doctor in our town that she could go to for chemotherapy. She just had her first taxol dose this past wednesday. She's done good so far, just really tired. When she started out.. it was decided she was going to have dose dense (every 2wks) AC Taxol. The doctor she's going to in our hometown, we've heard he has a major ego problem. Instead of giving her chemo every 2 wks, he wants to give it to her every 3 wks. She received the AC every 2 wks from the onc. 2 hours away. I've heard doing the dose dense is much more effective. He really doesn't have a reason why he decided on the 3 week dose. My question is: Is the Taxol just effective if taken every 3 wks rather than every 2 wks. Please let me know. Love, Danielle

Posts.Title: First time post!

Posts.Content: Thanks to everyone who responded and to everyone that will respond. I know lymph nodes play a big factor in this. We go tomorrow for them to surgically remove 2-3 lymph nodes to test them. I see on everyone's profile on here about the PR/ER statuses. They haven't tested her for any of this. Do they not do this until after the mast.?? We have had one doctor say it was .6cm and another say it was 1cm.. we are leaning more toward the doctor that is saying its 1 cm. Again, I appreciate the advice, encouragement and concern. Thanks so much to everyone!! Danielle I will let everyone know thursday night how everything goes with her surgery.

Posts.Title: Chemo question for the docs or anyone that might know

Posts.Content: My mom is scheduled for a mast. next tuesday. They did a lumpectomy a bout a month and a half ago and there are 3 calcium deposits left in her breast. They cannot tell if theya re malignant until they take them out so they want to do a mast. I've read so many ppl's profiles on here, and most of the ones that had a mastectomy only had to have radiation. Is there a reason for her to do chemo? She wants to do it if its needed, but she doesnt want to if its not necessary. Please let me know Danielle

Posts.Title: How do you make a profile?

Posts.Content: Hey everybody! Well my mom should start chemo next week. She will go the day before to get the port put in and the following for the first chemo treatment. About the disability, she owns her own business. It is a pretty successful cleaning business. But, while taking chemo, she won't be able to do all these tihngs b/c of germs and the chemicals in cleaning supplies. I can help some, but I can't handle all the jobs alone. They told her she could get disability if she was out for 1 year!! Well what in the world will she do for a year???/ Does anyone know any financial assistance programs for breast cancer or something in the like? Please let me know! Thanks everybody for being so supportive through this nightmare! Danielle

We feel like we can't ask him questions sometimes b/c he acts like we're insulting his intelligence. Pleaes help Danielle

Posts.Title: Bone and CT scans

Posts.Content: Hey everybody! Its been a while since i've been on here. I hope everyone is doing great. Well my mom just finished the AC part of chemo. She starts wednesday with the taxol part. She will have 4 treatments over a period of 8weeks. The first 3 treatments of AC went great. But after the 4th, its been TERRIBLE. SHe has been soo sick and so weak. Her onc. told her to stop the neupogen injections b/c she was breaking out all over her body. SHe has always had eczema on her back, but its spread to her legs, arms, chest and all over her back. its so hard seeing her like this. Fortunately, today she had a good day for the first time in almost 2 wks. Does anyone have any info on Taxol? We just want some kind of idea of what to expect and if its anything like the taxol. If anyone has any information to give me on rxns to neupogen shots or to the taxol, please let me know I would really appreciate it. Thank you for taking the time to read this Love Danielle
Posts.Signature: My mom She is 44 Diagnosed 3/7/05 Lumpectomy Mastectomy 3/29/05 Lymph node biopsy 3/24/05 1 cm Invasive Ductal Carcinoma Stage IIA Chemo started 5/5/05 AC Taxol (dose dense) Neupogen shots every other day for 4 months ER+
Posts.Title: Questions and update on mom

Posts.Content: Hey Di! Thank you for responding. What did they change your nausea meds too? I was just curious b/c she has had some nausea after this 4th AC. She went to the onc. today and they said her WBC was LOW! So she started her neupogen shots again tonight so hopefull it will boost her WBC. I look forward to hearing from you again! Thanks again, Danielle
Posts.Signature: My mom She is 44 Diagnosed 3/7/05 Lumpectomy Mastectomy 3/29/05 Lymph node biopsy 3/24/05 1 cm Invasive Ductal Carcinoma Stage IIA Chemo started 5/5/05 AC Taxol (dose dense) Neupogen shots every other day for 4 months ER+
Posts.Title: Questions and update on mom

Posts.Content: Hey my name is Danielle. My mom just found out this week that she has breast cancer. She is only 44 and I am 19. I am trying to be positive of everything, but it so hard because we are best friends. Her pathology report came back saying it was infiltrating (invasive) ductal carcinoma. It was .6 cm. Not very big, but its a big deal to me. They are talking about doing a masectomy. She goes next wednesday to find out more. If anyone has any info or encouragement or has been through the same, please let me know. Emails are welcome also. My email is [email protected]. I look forward to reading the forums everyday. Danielle

I will let you know how wednesday goes, and maybe it will be similar to yours so you can give me information or advice on everything. Danielle

Posts.Signature: My mom She is 44 Diagnosed 3/7/05 Lumpectomy Mastectomy 3/29/05 Lymph node biopsy 3/24/05 1 cm Invasive Ductal Carcinoma Stage IIA Chemo started 5/5/05 AC Taxol (dose dense) Neupogen shots every other day for 4 months ER+
Posts.Title: My mom just found out

Posts.Content: Hi Lauri!! It seems like your daughter was in the same situation I am in. I am a college student, but fortunately I live at home. I plan on attending every doctor's appt. with her. All my professors are VERY understanding. That helps a lot. On February 4th, my mom had a lumpectomy, she got results back a week later. They sent it to our local hospital lab, and it came back benign. We were so happy. BUT three weeks later, the radiologist found out that it came back benign and had the lab work sent to another hospital ( a much better more known hospital) and it came back malignant. Invasive Ductal Carcinoma. How are you doing now? Did you have cancer treatments? If so, how did you do with them? Let me know!! THanks for responding, Danielle
Posts.Signature: My mom She is 44 Diagnosed 3/7/05 Lumpectomy Mastectomy 3/29/05 Lymph node biopsy 3/24/05 1 cm Invasive Ductal Carcinoma Stage IIA Chemo started 5/5/05 AC Taxol (dose dense) Neupogen shots every other day for 4 months ER+
Posts.Title: My mom just found out

Posts.Content: Thanks to you all that responded. We are doing better and better everyday. We go back tomorrow so she can have her heart tested to make sure its strong enough for chemo, and a check up with the plastic surgeon. I will post what type of chemo she will have after we find out for sure tomorrow. Danielle

Posts.Title: Update on Mom

Posts.Content: My mom finished up her treatments 5 weeks ago. She had some fluid retention while taking taxol. Well she eats no more, if not less,than she did before she started chemo and now walks 2 miles per day and just seems to be putting on weight. Her hands and feet are a little swollen. Could this be fluid retention or weight gain? Thanks Danielle
Posts.Signature: My mom She is 44 Diagnosed 3/7/05 Lumpectomy Mastectomy 3/29/05 Lymph node biopsy 3/24/05 1 cm Invasive Ductal Carcinoma Stage IIA Chemo started 5/5/05 AC Taxol (dose dense) Neupogen shots every other day for 4 months ER+
Posts.Title: Taxol and weight gain

Posts.Content: Hey everybody. Sorry I haven't posted anything lately. My mom had her lymph node biopsy 2 weeks ago, they took out 2 nodes, one came back with a very small cancer on it. She went last thursday and had her mast. reconstruction and they took out a lot of her other lymph nodes. She was pretty sick after surgery but got to come home 2 days later. She's doing much better. We went this past wednesday (the 6th) and got a good report. The cancer had not spread to any of her other lymph nodes except that one. Her cancer is also estrogen receptive positive. She starts chemotherapy in about 3-4 weeks. She's not looking forward to it, but we will get through it. She will have 4 treatments over a period of 12-16 wks. I know some people do ok with it, but some people don't. She is having second thoughts b/c she believes by what the docs said that they got all the cancer, but we hate to take that chance just in case it had spread somewhere else. Danielle
